goal.en: (1) This course introduces students to various types of mathematical analysis commonly needed in scientific computing. (2) The subject of numerical analysis is treated from a mathematical point of view, offering a complete analysis of methods for scientific computing with appropriate motivations and careful proofs.
goal.ch: (1) This course introduces students to various types of mathematical analysis commonly needed in scientific computing. (2) The subject of numerical analysis is treated from a mathematical point of view, offering a complete analysis of methods for scientific computing with appropriate motivations and careful proofs.

content.en:
Prerequisites: Calculus, Linear Algebra, and some knowledge of the software package MATLAB
This course will cover the following topics:
(1) Eigenvalue problems (continued)
(2) Interpolation and approximation
(3) Differentiation and integration
(4) Numerical ordinary differential equations
(5) Numerical partial differential equations
Course transparency sets in PDF are available at
http://www.math.ncu.edu.tw/~syyang/
